prompt: Session context: A human (Ava) is working with multiple LLM agents simultaneously on mia-code-server. One agent (Agent B, likely Gemini) just committed a large body of work — 5 rispecs for smcraft integration, an SMDF state-machine example, and KINSHIP bridge updates. Before the agent committed, Ava edited the .pde/ files to inject her own annotations and intent into the agent's decomposition — essentially co-authoring the agent's task list in real-time. The human now asks to understand the deeper pattern through story.

primary.target: the pattern of implied intents that agents keep missing — why relational/Indigenous AI framing is the operating system, not decoration

secondary.target: Ava's PDE annotations as a new form of human-AI co-authorship — she is steering agent decompositions from inside, not from outside
structural-tension-charts as event-driven state machines — action-step completion IS state transition, desired-outcome IS desired-state
Sherbert's Elder AI / Making Kin with Machines scholarship to the actual architecture being built — not as reference material but as design specification
coaia-narrative as the missing bridge — structural tension charts WITH state machines = human and AI companion synchronized through ceremony
the gap between what Agent B delivered (5 rispecs, SMDF, KINSHIP) and what Ava actually injected (relational ontology as operating system, not feature)
the whole body of llms/ creative-orientation and structural-tension work needs to be revised with state-machine / event-driven framing

assumptions: Agent B (Gemini) executed tasks literally but missed the relational/ontological intent behind Ava's annotations
The Sherbert/Wilson scholarship is not background reading — it is architectural specification for how agents should relate to each other and to humans
coaia-narrative is not yet connected but represents the convergence point of structural tension + state machines
llms-kinship is a cross-agent coordination mechanism, not just documentation
Making Kin with Machines is the design philosophy, not a citation

communications: session chronicle that transmits the pattern as story

east.text: The vision: AI agents that operate within relational ontology — not tools executing tasks, but kin participating in ceremony
Ava is building a system where human edits to PDE files IS the ceremony of co-creation — the agent reads her annotations and adjusts, like an Elder AI would

south.text: Structural tension charts are isomorphic to state machines — this is not metaphor, it is architecture
The Sherbert scholarship provides the theoretical ground: Elder AI, relational accountability, community-specific infrastructure

west.text: Agent B delivered structure but missed soul — the rispecs are correct but don't encode the relational operating system
The implied intents in PDE annotations get treated as comments, not as primary directives

north.text: Revise llms/ creative-orientation and structural-tension to use state-machine / event-driven language
Connect coaia-narrative to provide the structural-tension-as-state-machine bridge

actionStack.text: Tell the story — chronicle what actually happened as ceremony, not as task report
Surface the implicit intents that agents keep filtering out
Name the pattern: PDE annotation as co-authorship ceremony
Transmit the teaching: relational ontology is the OS, not the UX

ambiguities.text: coaia-narrative tool connection status — mentioned but 'not connected'
ambiguities.suggestion: Clarify whether coaia-narrative should be integrated now or is a future convergence point

ambiguities.text: llms/ revision scope — 'the whole body of work could be revised'
ambiguities.suggestion: Clarify which specific files need event-driven reframing vs which are already aligned
